abstract: JPMorgan Chase, bowing to shareholder pressure, says it will publicly disclose any instance in which it claws back money from top executives.
lead_paragraph: After resisting calls for more information, the bank says it will make a public disclosure any time it claws back money from any member of the company’s operating committee.

headline.main: JPMorgan Says It Will Publicly Disclose Pay Clawbacks
headline.print_headline: Business Briefing; JPMorgan Agrees to Disclose Information on ‘Clawbacks’

snippet: After resisting calls for more information, the bank says it will make a public disclosure any time it claws back money from any member of the company’s operating committee.
